name: Courtyard Philadelphia Downtown

reviews.text: We chose to stay at the courtyard instead of the large Marriott hotel and found it was much quieter and friendlier but with the same great location. Service was excellent.
reviews.title: Great location and very friendly staff

reviews.text: Stayed here while attending a conference & really enjoyed it. Close to the conference center, Marriott & Loews, which is where the sessions were held. While it didn't have a complimentary breakfast, it did have free internet, which many other hotels in the area charged for. It's also only a short block walk to the airport rail line, wine store, Macy's, and the wonderful market full of restaurants and shops. Would have been nice to have a small fridge in the room, tho.
reviews.title: Perfect location for conventin center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I decided to stay a night in Downtown Philly a few nights earlier and found a great deal at the Courtyard. It was definitely worth the $ I spent (We were even upgraded to a suite, which was VERY nice), but I was a little let down by housekeeping. There were a few hairs in the bathroom, and an old room key on the floor by the door. There was also only one bedside table, so if you like to have a drink by the bed, you better call the side with the table first! The staff was AMAZING, and coming from a hospitality background, I was really impressed with the Front Desk. The price of parking was pretty high. We ended up parking in a public pay lot for less than half the price of parking at the hotel and only had to walk 3 blocks. (Worth the walk to save over $20)
reviews.title: Worth it.

reviews.text: This hotel was excellent. Great location and staff was super. The only thing that keeps me from giving it a straight excellent is the valet parking. As noted here it is a complete rip off at 42 bucks a night. We came into town in the dark and don't know the area at all. As a result we took the bath for parking. There are loads of places to park near the hotel if you know where to look. I must say the valet’s were very friendly as was the entire staff. Otherwise this was an excellent value at 90 dollars a night (AAA).
reviews.title: Excellent staff and location

reviews.text: Five friends and I booked three rooms at the Courtyard Downtown this past Saturday February 28th for a one night stay. We were in town for the Philadelphia Flower Show which opened on Sunday morning. This was not my first stay at this hotel but it was a first stay for some of my other companions.
reviews.title: Great service...with a smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Building recycling at its best: the building is the ex-City Hall Annex, and it's hard to get more central than that--a block from Reading Market, easy stroll to Ben Franklin Parkway institutions. The rooms, security etc. are up to the latest standards. The major negative is the expensive parking, but even here there is a solution for weekend visitors: the "Love Park" (JFK Plaza) parking garage is $8.50 on weekends, and only a block away across a pedestrian plaza. Also, being at City Hall, you also have to walk a few blocks through rather dreary neighborhoods to get to the excellent nearby restaurants.
reviews.title: Excellent location, good price, and weekends you can avoid the hotel's expensive parking

reviews.text: My grandma, my mother and myself stayed at this hotel over Columbus Day weekend. It was our first time in Phila and the location was perfect for that. Right in front of the gorgeous City Hall, we couldn't have asked for a more central place. It was just 15 minutes walking to the historic mall, 10 minutes to the theaters and right on the doorstep of many shopping/reastaurant areas. The staff was very courteous and attended every request we made upon reservation. By the by, this was made through the hotels website, which offered the best prices.
reviews.title: Great, great value!!!

reviews.text: When I return this beautiful city, I'll surely try to stay here again!
reviews.title: Nice Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have always been comfortable (generally speaking) at Marriott's. However, I have often found that the Courtyard brand can often vary in quality. This location surely tops the high end. The hotel is in a great historic building right across from city hall. The lobby and guest rooms are well appointed. The hotel is conveniently located to mots Philly attractions. Basically, this hotel is on par to a regular Marriott. If it didn't say Courtyard on the sign - I would never know!
reviews.title: Wonderful location, great weekend

reviews.text: My wife and I went to Philly for a wedding and stayed at the Courtyard Downtown on Juniper. Getting into the hotel from the airport was easy, we took the SEPTA train and got off at Suburban station that is only 2 blocks from the hotel. The staff was great and upgraded our room based on my Marriott status. The location of this hotel is great. We saw the liberty bell and walked around the historic parts of Philly. Cabs were easy to get and I would say they are better than the tourist bus that go up and down the main street. There are some wonderful restaurants within a short distance of the restaurant (Davios was great) and make sure to walk through the Reading Terminal market. Also don't miss a tour ofthe Masonic Lodge next door to the hotel. It is a wonderful building and the meeting rooms they take you through are spectacular. Overall, this was a great hotel and one of the best Courtyards I have stayed at.
reviews.title: Courtyard by Marriott is a Gem!

reviews.text: I've stayed multiple times at this Courtyard Marriott and have always been pleased with this choice. Being used to cities - the cost (over $150.00 a night and higher) is the norm, and quite affordable considering all the other chains surrounding which run higher. Location - Location - Location. Right across from multiple subway lines (both from city hall across the street and the convention center stops, as well as several street entrances) These lines take you to most tourist areas and the sports complex of pro sports of any type. All very walkable and safe in the PM getting back to the hotel. The SEPTA train (from the airport) is also right across the street, as well as a few stop SEPTA connection to Amtrak - making it a great convenience for the car-less.
reviews.title: Phabulous in Philly

reviews.text: Reading Terminal for eating and shopping is also across the street - which is awesome and very affordable with the new $7.00 lunches offered. You can snack out on all of Philly's best here and do some great picnic or even food shopping to take home with you. Most of all the historical sites (ie: Independance Park) are within a eight block or so walking distance - via mid town walk, or taking a look and eat at Chinatown area. Rittenburg Square is within five blocks in the other directions and you can even walk down to funky South Street, the jewelry district or Penn's Landing Waterfront. It's not unreasonable at all - but subway access is there si you have tired feet or endless stops for the Philly Flash a cheapo trolley (less than $2.00 ride not matter where you go) loop that will atke you to all the hot/touristy/ or eating/drink areas. There are also plenty of food choices around the hotel area (a la restaurants) as well as fast food/Starbucks etc etc.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Room!

reviews.text: The hotel itself is smaller, but very clean, comfy beds, reasonable size rooms for a historical building. All the usual amenities and spotless. Nice baths, shower heads good and excellent water pressure. Ther is no safe in the room (which is usual for Courtyards - anyway. There is a lounge and a full service restaurant (didn't try - but mostly never eat at hotels anyway - but breakfast certainly looked good!). There is a pool and fitness center that are really nice - and a boarding pass computer at your service. Staff are helpful and very friendly. Excellent location/conveneince and excellent housekeeping - I certainly think this is a fine and safe value for a city hotel.
reviews.title: Good Location, Good Service, A bit pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband was traveling on business, so the whole family tagged along. We had a two room suite, and it fit our needs perfectly. Our 8 year old slept on the pull out sofa bed and our toddler slept in her pack & play. Adults were in the bedroom, which had a door for some added privacy. There was a small kitchenette area with a mini fridge and a microwave, which is a nice convenience when traveling with kids.. The two rooms were spacious enough that the kids had some room to play and we didn't feel like we were on top of each other. Each room had a large flat screen TV. The hotel was within walking distance to Independence Hall, etc. The hotel itself had a historical look and feel to the outside and to the lobby areas, but the rooms were totally updated with all modern touches. An indoor swimming pool was not huge, but it was another activity to keep the kids busy. We weren't too worried about the price since this was a business trip, but I'd say the price for a 2-room suite in the middle of downtown Philly during the week was fair. Everything was clean and the bathroom was spotless. The only complaint we had was the parking. The loading/unloading area in front of the hotel was very small and quite congested. When my husband called for the car on a Tuesday morning, it took 40 minutes for the staff to bring it around. These weren't major issues, but just something to keep in mind for future visits. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the heart of Philadelphia.
reviews.title: Old Town Look outside, very nicely upgraded inside

reviews.text: Ok for the not so good news-- the price was $200/night during the week, when there was no major conference in town. Now for the good news -- the hotel was clean, staff was pleasant and accomodating, Philadelphia's downtown is very walkable and despite troubling crime rates...I felt safe walking from my meetings after 10pm nightly. I didn't eat in the hotel (I seldom do in a city the size of Phily) so I can't comment on that. However, several coffee shops and chain restaurants were closeby in the Market Street area. If I stay again, I will shoot for a much better price. It shouldn't be over $149/night.
reviews.title: Best value for the $ in Philadelphia
Good hotel in an ideal location.
reviews.text: The positives: this hotel is in the center of Center City, so you can walk or take the subway to most anything a tourist would want to get to. The room was exceptionally large, with a large flat screen TV, and very comfy beds It's an old city office building that has been converted, so the exterior and interior have more character than the average Courtyard. Only negatives are: (1) I never once saw the concierge at his/her desk; (2) the Sunday brunch at the restaurant might have gone more smoothly with better staff organization. Do not pay the outrageous valet parking fees ($40+ I think). We parked at the JFK/Love Park city garage three blocks away and paid their weekend rate of $8.50 for the entire weekend. All in all, a very nice hotel. I would definitely go back.

reviews.title: Nice Hotel with slow elevators and bad valet parking
reviews.text: Elevators seem to take forever to arrive in the rear lobby. Also, getting my car from valet parking on Sunday at checkout took almost an hour. The room was very clean and well furnished. All the staff we interacted with were very nice. We booked a corner executive suite and were amazed at how big the room was for the price.

reviews.title: Excellent location, very roomy!
reviews.text: I stayed in October of 2009 and have been meaning to write up a review for this hotel. Its in a great location of many tourist attractions. The rooms are spacious. The staff was extremely friendly. I recommend that you park a few blocks away at the Latimer Garage on Latimer St. its only $15 for 24 hours rather then pay the hotel prices of over $30 a night which is the rate at most hotels. I stayed on a Saturday night before going to an Eagles game. Its within walking distance of many great bars in Philly. I would highly recommend the hotel!

reviews.title: Very highly recommended
reviews.text: My experience here was wonderful. Brilliant location walking distance for sightseeing and shopping, Right beside City hall and Reading market with wonderful places to eat. My room was on the 6th floor over the front entrance and the view was superb. staff were friendly, helpful and smiling. room was spotless and very comfortable. breakfast provided a huge range to satisfy all tastes. I would definitely stay here again

reviews.title: Great Marriott Property!
reviews.text: We stayed for a long weekend in January to visit our son in the area. Got a great rate on Marriott website for $87 a night-they had a 20% off weekend rate. The location is perfect, beds comfy and the staff is friendly. The elevators on the far east side of the lobby are a little slow in the morning. We didn't eat at the hotel, but had drinks every night in the bar. The staff was great and the drinks reasonably priced for a downtown location. The restaurants in Philly are superb- check out LaViola (Italian), Fuji Mountain (Japanese) and great breakfast/brunch place called Day by Day. We would definately stay here again and probably will.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd start by saying the location of this hotel can't be beat. You are within walking distance to just about anything worth doing or seeing in Philly.
reviews.title: Can't wait to get home... or to a competitor hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BUT, I can't believe that a one of the largest hotel chains in the world, in one of the biggest cities in the world, can't find fitted sheets that actually FIT the bed! And the mattress was old and worn feeling. This was no feathertop mattress. It was a soggy old beater with a paper thin mattress pad.
reviews.title: Philadelphia Freedom

reviews.text: We asked for sheets that fit the bed becasue the ones we had keep sliding off and coming undone. We were assured our mattress would be fitted with properly fitting sheets. All seemed good until about 130am. The sheet had slipped off again. Neither of us are unusually shaped or weigh very much. I'm 157lbs (with shoes on) and my wife weighs considerable less than I do. And the mattress was not very thick. Less than a foot thick.
reviews.title: Mother's Day Weekend
Moderate service for an expensive stay
reviews.text: SO why? Why can't the Courtyard Marriott in Philadelphia put sheets on the mattress that stay on through the night?
We came from NYC to see the Galileo exhibit at the Franklin Institute and the Cezanne exhibit at the Art Museum (both really great btw).
reviews.title: Good convention center hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on a short weekend trip to Philadelphia. We got the hotel for a really reasonable price thru Priceline.
reviews.title: Great Location, Friendly Staff--Would Stay Again.

reviews.text: When we arrived, my husband asked if there was any way we could have a room with a nice view. The man at the front desk gave us a great room overlooking the City Hall. It was an awesome view.
reviews.title: Good but not Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean, spacious, and comfortable. The location is excellent-we walked everywhere. It is close to Reading Terminal, which is very cool.
reviews.title: Great spot - Excellent hotel

reviews.text: We would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Sweet Dreams

reviews.text: Nice hotel. Very good location at City Hall near the Reading Market. Most of the historical city is walkable from the hotel. A good choice for a central city location.
reviews.title: Fabulous Home Base for a Week Long Visit
Would stay again
reviews.text: Stayed one night at Courtyard and found the hotel to be nice. It was clean and the rooms were large enough for a family. Some noise in the hallway at night but, not the hotel's fault. The indoor pool was small but, adequate. Whirlpool was nice. Exercise room was incredible and state of the art. We had valet parking and breakfast included in our rate. It was $20 more than the basic room but a good deal as parking is $36 and the breakfast buffet for 2 adults was $33 plus tax/tip. Nice hotel in the heart of Philly.

reviews.title: A fairly simple hotel in a central location.
reviews.text: This was a fairly simple hotel in a central location. The room, bed and bathroom were adequate, clean and tidy. If you get it at a good price there is nothing wrong with this hotel.

reviews.title: Nice stay
reviews.text: I recently stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel was in a good location. It was clean, quiet and a good value. Staff was very helpful and accomodating. I would recommend it.

reviews.title: Good place overall
reviews.text: Good hotel overall with some exceptions. We had been expecting a nice pool experience, but found the pool was only 3 feet deep at the deep end and very small. The work-out facility was adequate. We upgraded to an executive room, and had plenty of space to stretch out, with a separate sitting area and pull out couch perfect for our teenager. We expected a newspaper to be delivered but was informed the service was stopped so the hotel could become greener.

reviews.title: Stay at the 'Other Marriott'
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here this past weekend for a convention. That stated, it was well located--half a block from the Reading Terminal Market, which was fantastic for breakfast and lunch, and a few short steps from the other Marriott, which was actually attached to the convention center. The 'other Marriott' would have been a much better choice for several reasons; the service was great (I left my coat at the bar one night and returned the next, and it was returned to me via concierge), the bar was lovely (fountain-side bar with great martinis) and there was a respectable restaurant. The whole thing kind of reminded us of Las Vegas--but again, I'm talking about the OTHER Marriott. The Marriott we stayed in--the Marriott in question in this review--consisted of a teeny, tiny valet parking area (valet parking is key, because of the location directly across from city hall, on a crazy-busy street), a very clearly 'used to be a government building' lobby, and the odd layout of the rooms. And all of that would have been ok if it was not for the shoddy state of the room itself. We were on the 15th floor, and our TINY window did afford a great view of city hall--you could look down upon it--but that's where 'nice' ended. The wallpaper was pocked with spackle, the mirrors rimmed with flaking painted frames, and the layout of the bathroom was beyond inconvenient, especially for two people trying to get ready for a convention at the same time; it was difficult to fit in there by yourself, never mind trying to dry your hair whist your partner brushes his teeth. That was simply not an option. Additionally, there were disturbing gray stains on the bathroom floor, and I don't know that the shower was cleaned before we checked in. If we return here, we will stay at the Marriott next door, to which I would have given a glowing review, having never stepped into an actual guest room. Please note: we didn't even PAY for this room, as it was a business trip, and I was still disappointed enough to write this review. That should mean something. Seriously--stay next door.
This is one of the best marriott courtyards I have ever stayed in. Friendly staff, hotel in a great downtown location with comfortable rooms. Will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel - will definitely stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building is GORGEOUS. I really liked this hotel. It was in a great location. The pool/hot tub was great. I used priceline and got the room for $80+ tax, and the hotel ended up being a steal for that price. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other people, and I would probably pay more than what I paid to stay there.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is housed in a preserved historic building located right in the heart of Philly's downtown area, close to the subway station. The lobby is absolutely beautiful, the staff helpful and considerate, and the rooms flawlessly neat -- we couldn't ask for more for the price that we paid, less than $100 a night. Special mention for the valet parking staff which was super-helpful. We booked through the Marriott's site and got a great rate considering it was a holiday weekend.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, wonderful hotel
Top Notch Personnel
reviews.text: Highly, highly recommended.

reviews.title: Love Philadelphia
reviews.text: Recommend to anyone. Staff is top notch! Location is awesome. Cannot get lost looking for hotel. Don't know if I should recommend highly because the next time I want to stay there, there won't be room. Change my mind, stay somewhere else.

description: A nice property located near the city's Convention Center.
